obN0bzXvvrTioJo853AWfA.text: My family and I just had lunch here and we used to frequent this location ask throughout my childhood.  We took my in-laws here to enjoy a fun meal with my 8 month old.  While our server was a kind, courteous, and funny gentleman our chef was the complete opposite. My husband cannot eat mushrooms due to a medical condition (allergy like) and the chef was extremely agitated that he had to make our veggies separate.  He was not only openly agitated he didn't once smile, make any attempt at conversation, or did any sort of tricks for entertainment.  It was my son's first experience and it was awful.  My entire family felt completely offended that our chef was so unpleasant.  15% Gratuity was automatically added to my bill due to our party of 8 and I felt like it wasn't earned.  If I could have tipped only our server I would have but the experience overall did not deserve 15%!

3rT4OSJZ3ZTLsrjw_988fQ.text: racist owner and staff, go to  Nikkos south blvd way better then this garbage place. Not a clean place, saw a few roaches never again...

WiapsyKpH9oS6abKztrFzQ.text: Although I went on a Weds. Night for the half off sushi I ended up with a shrimp hibachi meal that I could not even finish! Overall the food was very good and I had plenty of left overs to eat the next day . Our cook was really nice and did all of the normal tricks and what not. I did expect a bigger restaurant when I walked in but I guess it's a good amount of space! It seemed like they had maybe 4 or 5 hibachi tables and then other normal dining room tables for non-hibachi patrons. The table behind us seemed to have an issue with their cook but it looked like the manager took care of that quickly. Overall I would come back it's a decent priced hibachi meal with quick service. The parking in front of the restaurant seems a bit tight not sure if there was more in the back but I can only imagine what it's like on a fri sat night!

ufTqE8YVTsd8i43wY6e41A.text: Can I just say I absolutely love this place!  I was actually a waitress here back in 2005. I left because I moved back to los Angeles California and yet I have not found a place that is as good as kabutos. They have benihanas out here yet still not up to kabutos level. I would really love to see a kabutos out here! I think I might just take a flight to north Carolina to have some kabutos.  Great owners and staff. Try the shrimp sauce on your rice. The best!!

UkCzBtwsm_t6wrsbF1EvgA.text: If you like the feel of eating off the floor of a sticky movie theater, then this is your place. Nothing like it used to be back in the day. Go to Nakatos down the street for a better experience. Food was so so and the experience was disappointing, prob won't go back, even if it was free.

L1Es4diqaGkUKAdWOX3AnA.text: The first time here was very good, food was tasty and service was good. We did  go back two other times. Last time we went was the last time. The cook we had the very last time was awful,  not accomodating, dry and did not really care to serve us. With that incident, I personally will not go back and give that rude cook my money!

GPpSnhUmg4xJaWlK_culUg.text: I love Japanese steak houses. It's a lot of fun, and I love the theatricality in addition to the good food. Nothing in life is a delicious as ginger sauce, so that helps as well, and they're always accommodating for vegetarians.   I think Kabuto is a great option for a first date. You can talk to each other some, but if it's getting a little lame or if there's not chemistry, you can focus all your attention on the performance. It's also a lot of fun when my niece is visiting with the family, as she enjoys the fire and the food-tossing and all. The menu has enough variety to satisfy picky kid's appetites, and the show keeps them from getting too fussy, even as the evil bedtime witching hour approaches.

photos.caption: Photo of Kabuto Japanese Steak House & Sushi Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. From the website.
Photo of Kabuto Japanese Steak House & Sushi Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Hibachi steak from the website.

4JB88a8EdUOFzUezZcmlxw.text: I love the food and the prices.  Wed and Thursday  sushi half off.  Hospitality and  great customer service.  He owners are very nice and the waiters treat you with respect.

KcTgfYyYbWAPARbEAkumAg.text: So in my search to create a Japanese Steakhouse list, we stopped into Kabuto last night in the University Area. Sushi bar up front and the cook-tops in the back. It was a slow night, so I was curious to see the quality of the staff. Typical menu of soup, salad, rice, veggies, noodles and choice of meat around $18 for single, and $21 for combo.   When we arrived, the soup came out just as we sat down, then the waitress took our drink order. A little odd and rushed, but I moved on and enjoyed the soup. Next was the salad which came with a choice of ginger dressing or ranch. Unfortunately, it seemed like the salad w/dressing was sitting around for pre-made with dressing on top. Ginger dressing was chunky and watery...had one bite and set it to the side.   Next came the rice and veggies. To my surprise, the chef cooked everything at once and it wasn't done with the same excitement and precision as other steakhouses I've been to. After the rice, veggies and meat came the noodles...all piled on the same plate. I prefer the rice to be in a separate bowl, but well.   Overall...just OK. The chef was OK and the food was OK...gots of leftovers as always. They also get you in and out in less than an hour...some might feel rushed, but it felt OK to me as I wasn't able to eat that much because I didn't have a break in between the cooking of other items...it was all piled on.

G08s268gru8uvtmzHEsw5A.text: They don't serve sushi on Saturday nights, I was so disappointed! We were seated fairly quickly but waited over an hour for our food. It was nothing special, pretty basic compared to what I've seen elsewhere.

ok_CVgSDTUcQTVAPl3GGuw.text: Excellent service.  Chef was entertaining and very good.  Food ehhhhh a bit bland nothing really popped and was just mostly sort of bland.  And seems a bit pricy compared to other Japanese steak houses in the area.

cEtRdPqr62njC3z2058-nQ.text: Third visit. First was excellent. Second, the waitress didn't listen. Almost messed up our appetizer. Caught that. Told her we wanted our steak "pink thru out".  She said rare we said NO PINK THRU OUT. The meal came out rare. We were told it wS not "seasoned" because we ordered RARE,which we did not. We paid for the meal and took it home. Our next visit we ordered an Appetizer which was under cooked. We got an "attitude" from the mgr because we had a problem on our previous visit. If you you have a problem either don't complain or don't go back

H9Wg0RFVKmHoCXhBS20eiw.text: Since I live nearby and was craving sushi, I decided to give this place a shot. I ended up ordering for take out, but the first impression I got from the hostesses were that they were not friendly. They seemed rather unpleased, whether it might have been how I was dressed, or they just didn't want to be there. Regardless, I didn't seem to be welcomed.  After looking through the menu and realizing they don't have much to offer. I placed my order for a tuna, a spicy tuna roll, and a miso soup; (expecting the tuna roll to have the seaweed on the outside like how it's supposed to be, and the spicy tuna being a mixture of ground tuna and spicy sauce with the rice on the outside, and the miso soup with tofu and seaweed).  I was wrong to set my standards to the norm, and believe me when I say this.  Firstly; the tuna did not look like how it's supposed to be (a reddish color), which leaves me to believe that the fish may be of a lower quality or it's not fresh.   Secondly; All of the rolls had the rice on the outside and the tuna on the inside, with six rolls covered in spicy mayo sauce (and this is what you call spicy tuna?), placed unappetizingly in a styrofoam container.  Thirdly; The miso soup came in a styrofoam beverage cup, filled to 1/2 of the way with no tofu. Just seaweed and a salty soup base.   Overall: Don't go and waste your time/money for sushi. Definitely not worth it.

G1Iw0X5JkHr3UujQr6HAkw.text: On my never ending quest to find the best Japanese steakhouse in Charlotte, hubs and I ventured into Kabuto on a random weekday evening.   At first blush, this particular Kabuto isn't necessarily impressive from the outside or inside. When you walk in there is a room with a decent sized bar and a smattering of tables for the sushi eaters or hibachi haters - you choose. Since I was in the mood for a show, we choose to have the whole "experience" of hibachi and we led in the back room with eight or so double hibachi tables.   The menu is standard Japanese hibachi, running $15-$23 for your choice of protein(s). The accompaniments support the shoveling of food: clear/green onion soup, ginger salad, shrimp appetizer (2 shrimp) fried rice, vegetables, noodles and your choice of proteins. So...where did Kabuto falter a bit? The service was pretty solid, the hibachi show was mildly entertainment, but the food...was uninspired. Don't get me wrong, it was fine. But when I see a talented hibachi chef using big pads of butter to cook all of my food, it turns me off. Thus the food tasted like bland butter, not the crispy, tasty, fresh hibachi I love (where they typically use oil).   My other minor beef is that the food came out all at once - there was little to no pacing. So, everything butter laden was dumped on my plate. Meh. I'm giving this Kabuto three stars because our server was super attentive and the food was fine, but not great. However, I don't think I'll be back considering I enjoyed the whole experience at the other Japanese steakhouse just down the road.

prpP5wfzvSqmmK7YFUuRDw.text: Had the worst service ever there. I used to go on a regular basis, but the service has been going down hill and finally hit bottom. I really don't think the waitress spoke English. We waited for 20 minutes to get our check and had to ask again for someone to find our waitress for it to finally come. Then another 15 minutes to get our bill back. When we complained to the hostess, she said oh, ok.  There's plenty of Japanese Steak houses, we will now be going to another.

U2_A1gbDOmiLx1DZBOqlXA.text: Food: ekk...putting alto of soy sauce and butter doesn't make the food taste better...just salty.   Service: SUCKS big time...our waitress was so so slower were seated before another group and they done and left before we got our meal cooked. The orders were put in wrong. Keep having to ask for drinks refill; guess because of the over salty food.   Price: There's a saying "you get what you pay for" It's cheaper than Benihana. I rather go to Benihana and pay more and get better service and experience.  Overall: Would most likely not come back...the Pineville location is alot better.

yo7ew8CLIEHFA-zLLsuSYA.text: Ok first off the food was not cooked with any care. My daughter who was allergic to shrimp literally cried because the chef wasnt even skilled enough to cook it carefully on grill in front. So they made it in back and it literally took the whole meal for her to get it. She is 5 years old and loves hibachi. She cried simple as that. Now the food only thing was good was the scallops only because of the product not the cooking. My steak was over cooked i wanted rare to med rare came out med well nearly well. The chef joked like I was being sarcastic but it was bull literally bull caca. He wasnt funny, no volcanoe until i asked. No egg trick No sesame seeds again until i asked. He went to other chefs cart to get ingredients. This place blows and you will blow your hard earned cash. I am a chef myself. I have also worked in a kabuto but it was not this poorly ran or any degree near this. Not all kabutos suck but this was horrible. Get better chefs. The other 3-5 star reviews I am baffled that Charlotte thinks that it is quality hibachi? Read my reviews I have eatten hibachi all over. I speak the truth hopefullu yelp posts this for recommended because its not a lie one bit.

CDh_L113jnQ_rDN2nDkU3A.text: Nothing too exciting on the outside, I probably wouldn't have given Kabuto a shot  if it wasn't a UNCC hot stop for its half off sushi. Every Wednesday & Thursday they offer half off all the sushi/rolls- an awesome steal, it was the only thing ever getting me through my night class! Everything is always fresh-double points for fresh sushi.  I'll explain my 5 star rating in a quick second! I live right down the road from this place and It is weekly staple for my friends and I- even though I always forget to 'check in'.I think I just don't want my yelp friends to see how much I eat here! Since Yelp prides itself on local business- the two owners alone deserve 5 stars. Every night you will find both owners socializing with guests, filling drinks and even making rolls behind the bar- talk about hands on!  I can only review on the sushi portion since I haven't made it past the sushi bar in years.  If you're an adventurous sushi eater you must order off the specialty roll menu go for the Jackpot,Carolina , Harris or Arizona rolls- they won't disappoint! If you're looking for  something simple, spicy tuna always hits the spot.  If you're going to eat on a Wednesday or Thursday service my be a little slow- any other night, the sushi bar has always been speedy.  You can't pass up a sushi meal for 10-15 bucks!  Always a satisfying, fun and easy night out. Nothing too fancy!  See you next week...

bJ6DqJGCKHKx6nGNwp7TXg.text: We decided to go here in search of something different to eat and wanted an experience to go along with it.  The place is kind of dingy and run down looking around the restaurant on the inside, but hey we weren't here to look at pictures on the wall but see what one of our amazing (hopefully fingers crossed) cook can do in front of us.  So we are seated and there is another table adjacent to ours who was seated probably 5-10 minutes before we were.  With that being said, we received service from another cook and not theirs.  If we had the cook the table next to us had, I would have given this place four stars.  He had a lot of energy and was very personable with everyone at his table, something our server lacked.  He was just going through the motions, not much personality to go with him.  The volcano was the most exciting part of his "exhibition."  The food was decent enough.  I got the shrimp and it tasted good, just not enough shrimp as part of the dish.  This is not a place I would regularly go to, since it is a place reserved for more special occassions or dinner dates.  So, overall not the best or the worst experience, but my takeaway from it all is whoever your cook is can make or break your experience here.

1FU1-iTMff0Evenn0XtCDg.text: We had reservations for 6 for an adult birthday, with 2 children who were anxious for their 1st hibachi cooking experience. After being greeted with a brusque "how many?", we were led to a back table.  There, we experienced the worst overcooked meal by a chef who never spoke nor made any attempt to create the "Japanese experience".  The children with us craned their necks to try to see what was going on at another table that had the proper theatrics and applause. So disappointing!!  We had called in advance to ask for a seasoned chef to make the birthday especially nice!!  Our family loves to do birthdays at a Japanese restaurant, but we will not be returning to Kabuto!!  I am not sure if the chef ever got all the burned food remnants off that grill!!  Buyer beware!!

LcGZhncMkIMaXzHaWXNGrA.text: We've been here many times over the years and it continues to decline w each visit. Actually sitting here right now and have been sitting here waiting on my check for 20 minutes now. What a mess.  Our chef was mediocre at best, clearly the weak link of the group. The food was good, that was the upside. That said, I believe the portions have gotten smaller and smaller so at the end of the day there are better options in the market. Goodbye Kabuto

ojRZy8CuMETfx7U6mPn2sA.text: The worst service I have ever had at any restaurant and the manager could care less about it..  We were sat and it too our server 15 mins to come to the table and when she came she came with the soup and no beverages because she never came to get an order.  We ordered the dragon roll and a combination with all 3 meats sub filet and she messed that up.  While the chef was cooking I inquired about our sushi and that's when we were informed that the sushi chefs had left for the day.  The server sends the manager and he looks at us as if we did something wrong.  I have never in my life seen such blatant disregard for poor service.  If there is a corporate office I hope this reaches it.  You guys were horrible..

seeQOppPh2GKenb9fuXUOA.text: Food is great quality and the people are super friendly. Can't beat half price sushi on Wednesdays/Thursday's

RMmUdFk_iRO-1RtaGtWCug.text: It once was a great place to eat, but the quality of food is poor, its gotten really greasy and the portions of food is smaller than before. This was once my favorite place to go but no more. Ill be going to Nakato for now on.

bBa4vtAQE-TCYKxYEzMeeg.text: The food was very good . The waitress was very inventive . The only thing is my I felt so sick after eating it . I'm not sure if it's just my stomach not being able to handle it or what but I felt terrible . The staff at the front was very friendly and talkative

MZSC6Pjpxm70X-4NIBKMpw.text: We had reservations on Valentine's night, and even though it was for 8, we were sat closer to 9. However, this is partially assumed in busy holiday occasions. The servers were all friendly, and helpful. Checking on the possibility of substituting something out, and making sure drinks were filled. The chef was amusing and had our food cooked to order quickly, and still put on a show. (I had ordered the filet and shrimp)  My only complaint, and this wasn't something the restaurant could have helped, was the party that was sat at the table with us.

PtTE2O194UgMS3KrMHPwbg.text: We were happy with the experience... Stick with the traditional Saki though,  the favored versions are simply syrup added which takes away from the punch and heat. Drink a few Saki' 2 compliment the food - U. R. eating Japanese!!! Our chef was very entertaining & better than past experiences with other places in the category.

jOfD9HE1Wbq6vSVDQSeMbg.text: Wednesday nights and Thursday nights. 50% sushi discount. Need I say more?  Going in there the vibe was busy, because people know where to go to eat sushi. Some of the tables in the sushi area is a bit small, but overall, when people leave and clear out the seats open up. I had 2 other people with me when we went. The selection of special sushi of course isn't written up, so the trick here is to ask the waiter what off menu specials there are.  There are special rolls on the back on a white board, but that could be a little bigger to attract the customer's eyes and so it can be ordered more often instead of looking at the paper where customers usually order sushi. The dragon roll my friend ordered, she enjoyed it.  Overall though, I have definitely come here more than once because of the 50% discount and I have eaten my fair share of sushi here. I recommend to try out the hibachi grill as well they have in the back.

-ym9I_AzsILJIAJ2H0cxHw.text: Worst service ever. We arrived at 8 and were told that it would be a 30 minute wait. I left a birthday cake with the hostess and she told me she'd take care of the rest. We sat at the bar while we waited for a table. We ended up waiting over an hour just to be seated. When we were seated, it took the server 10 minutes to finally get our drink orders and another 10-15 to bring it to our table. Mind you, it's around 9:45 Wednesday evening at this time. The chef didn't come out until 10:00ish, after the restaurant has closed. He tried his best, but it was evident he was done for the night. No one ever brought our cake out- our server simply said no one informed her it was a birthday celebration, but the chef somehow knew? As soon as he finished cleaning the grill, the server brought us all to-go boxes, as if she wanted to rush us out the door. We were so disappointed and tired, we just put the food away and left.   To make our night even worse, by the time we got home at 11, every one of us had an upset stomach from the bit of food we did eat.  Wasted 3 hours and $200. Next time, we'll stick Fuji or even US Sushi.

5OhYm5kAM6BgUYsoExYGeA.text: Good food and service and karaoke night on Saturday is hilarious. The hibachi is great and if you want cheap decent sushi go for it! Very simple rolls and a menu where you check off what you want. Enjoyed it.

YsEH9SWa1THxoOOqE8DYmg.text: Been going here for over six years.   99% of the time, food great, service great.   Regular customer on Sunday.

n4BkrfBqdn0ItfOQHtXXtQ.text: Kabutos is good for what it is:  a Benihana-type restaurant.  A group of about 8 people sit around a giant grill and are entertained by the chef as he cooks the meals right in front of them, wielding sharp knives and doing tricks with each food item he prepares.  Kids especially love it and it's also good fun for a group of friends going out on the town.  The Hibachi dinners generally come with a salad with ginger dressing (YUM!), rice and veggies, an option of a choice of meat, and dipping sauces.  The flavor of the meal is very good despite the relatively few ingredients put into each (and I normally love a lot of spices).   And I do enjoy the entertainment of watching my meal prepared in front of me.  As for the sushi, I have yet to try it since I usually reserve eating sushi for when I visit sushi houses.  When I go to a Japanese steakhouse, I typically want the Hibachi show and food.   I haven't been to other Kabuto locations, but this particular Kabuto could use some refreshment.  It's a little dark and dingy inside with no particular decor or splashes of color.  Hence, part of my reasoning for only a 3-star rating.  Why else?  Kabutos isn't someplace I'd go out of my way for, but if someone's going I might tag along.  I've dined at Benihana's in L.A. and at Mitsukoshi at Epcot so, to me, Kabutos pales in comparison.  But hey--it's cheaper than a plane ticket!

photos.caption: Photo of Kabuto Japanese Steak House & Sushi Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Kabuto Japanese Steak House & Sushi Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States

IHvtiSrIPWyEgy4OiErwYg.text: Food -- 4 stars Hibachi grill was good. I had Filet and Shrimp and I thought it was very tasty. The chef wasn't a Hibachi entertainment pro, but he got the food tasting good and that is the most important thing.  Service -- 1 star Service was mediocre. For my party, the waiting staff consistly gaffed on our orders. One colleague wanted steamed rice but didnt get it. Another colleague received a beer with a cracked bottle lip, and almost cut herself. I ordered an appetizer and never got. While the staff was apologetic about the missing appetizer, the bottle incident was handled very poorly and left a very negative feeling from my coworker.  ***HOWEVER, the night I went there was a frat pledge party so with 100+ hormonal college kids wrecking havoc, I would give the staff a pass on that. They were managed decently well, but we were left out in terms of quality service.   Atmosphere -- 2 stars Meh.

idI-dR3N82NnIe3YjR3GSA.text: Word of mouth made me skeptical of this place but in not one to shy away from a restaurant because of what people say.   The restaurant- it's what you would expect of an establishment on this side of town. Bigger than what I thought. Nice little setup though.  The show- not as impressive as other Japanese restaurants I've been to. While the guy talked to is a lot and made us laugh, I didn't see much flying through the air like I'd hoped.  The food- fried rice and the steak was good. He cooked it to a nice medium rare, suggested a mustard sauce that was incredible paired up with it

qb7VkmiG_OtOclL6-FRN1w.text: Went for the 50% off sushi on Wednesdays(it's also on Thursdays both lunch and dinner) and I was pleasantly surprised. The sushi was awesome and fresh, and all sushi is included in the 50% deal, no limited menus or restrictions. I've been trying to find decent, budget friendly sushi since I moved to Charlotte, and this is by far one of my top choices. They don't have too many specialty rolls, so if you're looking for extravagant sushi you won't find it here, but still a solid sushi menu and just enough specialty rolls to make it worth it. I sat in the sushi bar area which is small but I believe they have more seating in the back at hibachi stations. Over all go on a Wednesday or Thursday for a good deal!

-ULT6_TKPt34tr_D4x4juw.text: the manager is a liar and pretty much  take your complaint as a joke . he refuse to give his real name after i told him i was doing a yelp review on the device i received today.  don't not eat here..the attitudes sucks of the staff and some of the mix drinks and food .

8fModmzifhhKg8M0aykiow.text: I'm home alone tonight so I decided to treat myself. I ordered filet mignon and chicken combo. I didn't get any soup- I guess they don't know how to do soup for take-out.  I'm not sure if I actually got filet instead of sirloin or strip- it was cooked beyond any recognition of cut, even though I ordered it medium. The ginger sauce on my lettuce (not really salad- just iceburg lettuce) wasn't good to me, but that may just be my taste. The chicken was pretty dry too.  The rice and vegetables were pretty decent. Overall though I was so let down and would not return.

XGykmAgbLsIl-dAVhRTlMg.text: Great place! Very entertaining!   Both the sushi and hibachi are excellent.....family owned too, and the owners seem to always be there involved with the restaurant...I can definitely appreciate that.

-uSxaxQJLMKcHZNvuOMxBg.text: We did the birthday dinner thing there with a group of people last weekend and it was a shoddy time to say the least. It took them forever to seat us which I don't particularly hold against them because I understand they like to wait for the entire party to arrive so they can flip tables better but it' always seems to drag forever. Once we got seated they took our orders and started rolling out the soups and salads. The best part was when I ordered Tempura with shrimp and the waiter asked me if that was sushi. Good stuff, Our chef guy was pretty spot on with the usual flamboyant spatula flipping and knife slicing and I'd probably say his show was the best part of the evening. The food itself was everything you would expect from hibachi style grill and the portions were generous.   After the meal they came out and sang the bday song and served up the cake just like usual so that part of the evening rolled fairly well. It just feels like the employees are going through the motions and sometimes its painful to watch them sing. Next time I'll request no less than three takes on the bday song each time telling them "needs more cowbell".   Time to pay the bill and get out right?....Sure, if you want to wait forever and a day. Oh yeah, and when my bill came it had my Tempura listed but that was a little bit of a thumb in the eye since the tempura never arrived to begin with. I had the guy remove it from the check which added even more time to the already lengthy process of getting the hell out.   The last "best part"of the evening is when the bartender from the bar area approached my buddy to pay his tab from when we were waiting for our table when we first arrived. My friend had already paid in cash though. Whoever the bartender guy was he totally missed the 20$ my friend laid on the bar for some beers and accosted him in front of everyone to pay up. The bartender eventually backed off which was a nice little concession but the insult was already there lingering in the air.   I'd give this place another try if the discounted sushi is as good as some of the reviews say. But standing on service, cost and cleanliness I'd recommend that you just shop around for a different place.

03T5nF-_5PPeHy3B03asRA.text: Great food. It's your average show hibachi. Ours was not that great because there was a small child at the table who was terrified of the loud noise and the flames. They did take her outside. The plum wine was delicious! If you want good hibachi and have the extra cash I'd recommend it.

J2KB9VjrBWzI6JyaDQmwtw.text: This place has been my favorite Japanese Hibachi grill for years. The service is great and I love the cooks little show that they put on. Recently I visited with my four children to celebrate my two oldest childrens birthday. I will say this last time I went the food seemed underseasoned so for that I am only giving them four stars. Also the gratuity that was added in was 17 dollars which is a meal so I was highly upset about that because I didn't receive 17 dollar food and service. I would come back because the biggest issue I had was the food seasoning or lack there of and that can easily be corrected with my suggestion of adding more while they are cooking it.

piSXaKI4b0dp_Qzbv9gJrQ.text: Only been two times, first time the food is good but customer service was awful, the wait staff girls just sit around and talk to each other and don't check on you, waited 10minutes for someone to get my tab. Second time I gave benefit of the doubt but even worse, when I asked the girl if she could take my tab she rolled her eyes and walked away, me and my friend were so confused then she came back and literally chucked, flopped the tab receipt at me and I finally said don't be rude and she rolled her eyes and still walked away. They should hire PROFESSIONAL workers, not bratty 15yr with attitudes. Never coming again! Go to My BENTO Asian Dinner! it's right down the street and the waitstaff are nice and professional! And they even have $10 for all you can eat sushi.

kzkI-Uh5q-3AURVpV4CkZA.text: Loved our experience at this Kabuto's. The manager was super polite and hilarious. I was impressed by the signs on the door courteously reminding everyone of the dress code, take your hood down and stuff of the like. The food as always was banging. Server was prompt and professional. Will always stop by for lunch when I'm in the area.

pqXT5hLCspCKr9IQ7YwbqA.text: I was actually in search of another place that serves hibachi, but I went here instead after seeing that it was closer and had good reviews as well. I must have been there on a bad day because the service was slow, the food was bland, and the price/portion was sad.   I ordered the vegetable hibachi with salad, no soup because it's made from shrimp-based broth and I'm vegetarian. I waited almost 25 mins before my food was ready for take out. The hostess handed me a bill ,which was about $11 and some change and I inquired if she had charged me for the soup as well even though I did not buy any. (They couldn't even replace the soup for one that was vegetable-based). She said that  they still have to charge you for it. Alright, that's fine. I look inside the takeout box to make sure my order is correct, and inside is the most pathetic portion I've ever seen: full of rice and a tiny portion of chopped up vegetables. The salad wasn't a real salad either: chunks of browned iceberg lettuce with a few shreds of carrot.   I was pretty upset about this so I told the hostess that the portion was a pretty bad size for $11 and they didn't even have enough vegetables in it. She gave me this "ummmm" look and stepped into the office with the cash register. I waited about a minute or two and she never came out; I left.  So the service was slow, portion was terrible for the price, and no one came out to address my issue.  Oh well, just my luck- but it gets worse: I get home and start eating my meal anyway, but it's so bland that I have to add my own soy sauce. The ginger dressing for the "salad" was fine and the best part was the chili sauce-  it was actually spicy and not oily. Good job Kabuto.  I might return to try their sushi, but I definitely won't be getting anything else here again, and I wouldn't recommend getting takeout from here as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Kabuto Japanese Steak House & Sushi Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. tons of rice with a tiny portion of vegetables :(

tH-TtVs0LerATLWaloWLtw.text: Our cook lacked the organizational skills to get the meal on our plates so that we could enjoy it without an item getting cold. But, he was pleasant and courteous, and I made it enjoyable because he was trying.  The owner should clean the carpets and be sure that all cooks are ready to entertain and get the food on your plate in a timely manner before they are called to service.

photos.caption: Photo of Kabuto Japanese Steak House & Sushi Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. The food was ok the cook lacked the organizational skills needed to get the food on our plates at once. The carpet needs cleaned

DIo7QVqi5jdDllOxjy-rYQ.text: Horrible service, subpar food. Will not return, I'll stick with Nakatos which is less than a mile from this location.

p8-YHs6lK08T1IsfsmDg7g.text: 4 stars for 1/2 price sushi on Wednesdays and Thursdays! Nothing incredibly inventive here. Basic sushi and good hibachi, if you choose to sit at one of the cook-in-front-of-you tables.   Not super accommodating of special sushi requests, but that could've just been the waitress. Overall the rolls were good for a great price. The sushi rice wasn't mushy (a huge pet peeve). And the service was efficient.   Don't come here for ambience, but if you need a cheap sushi fix, this should do it.

photos.caption: Photo of Kabuto Japanese Steak House & Sushi Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Kabuto Japanese Steak House & Sushi Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Kabuto Japanese Steak House & Sushi Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Onion ring roll and vegetable roll

6sMEwReQyDNrbBIikLsHtg.text: DO NOT STEP FOOT IN THIS RESTAURANT. Not only is there a lack of creativity on the menu, there is a major lack of customer service. The food was terrible and the wait staff was rude. The manager was confrontational and does not deserve to be in the service industry. I hope they have success selling the Tumbleweed Roll because that is going to be the only thing in place. It should continue to stay the ghost town it is until it is closed.

0ulIGy-SpD8E_H_Mg4ci5A.text: This used to be our go to hibachi restaurant until tonight. After eating here dozens of times in the last 2 years, we were told tonight that we can no longer order fried rice without vegetables mixed in it even though I have an allergy. When the manager was asked if an accommodation could be made we were told no, we could have the rice with vegetables or we could leave. He was incredibly rude. If you have an allergy or intolerance stay away because apparently they are doing well enough in their business that they can afford to turn customers away.

fUZ0Xu71BCnQCJaF8wdOXA.text: Great quick fix for sushi! Wednesday and Thursday 50% off sushi cannot be beat! Quick service and relaxed atmosphere.   I ordered two of their specialty rolls: dragon roll and Carolina Sunrise. Decent for the price but the dragon roll tasted a bit bland. The crab salad on top of the Carolina Sunrise had a bit of wasabi kick to it. I was expecting more of a volcano roll crab salad on top but this was a nice surprise.   My cousin got the lucky 7 and jack pot rolls. Lucky 7 really hit the spot! Most of their specialty rolls consisted of shrimp tempura.

fUSTz-Q7A_V1Z3sRqUc2JA.text: First off kabuto service is bad managers both suck also their food is trash fried rice be in the back for so long it's like there kept in a rice cooker or microwave it because it don't even taste fresh only reason why I go is because of Pablo "yeaaaah baby"-Pablo voice

zGXJaewjdByKBXI7_fD36w.text: Great food!  Try the mustard sauce! Great lunch spot. They will cook for one in the dining room or at the hibachi tables if nobody else comes in within ten min on a weekday!

ZxqCHKOv7qLncH0AnUjk7Q.text: I'm not a huge hibachi fan, but my husband loves it.  This place has really good hibachi, if you're into that.  You get a ton of food.  The chef put on a good show.  Actually, after he was done cooking, he told me that he had accidentally shorted me on shrimp and that they were cooking more in the back to bring out to me.  I was really impressed with his honesty, because I never would have noticed that he hadn't given me enough. The service was great, too.  My drink never got low.  My only complaint is that it's pretty expensive.  The next time my husband craves hibachi though, we'll be back.

btNmqr0N8jf9TRwNZ73-CA.text: Very delicious and huge amount of food! I went with a group of 5 and one was a child.  We all loved the food being made in front of us.  Our waiter was great and joked around and didn't just do his part and leave.   We had the chicken and steak hibachi and everyone's food was cooked deliciously.  The child only wanted noodles but the chef was so kind and even gave her some chicken and rice.     The rice, noodles, veggies, and meat were cooked to perfection and the other people that were sat with us were fun to be around also! The portions were amazing! So much food that I took about half of mine home!  I would recommend the hibachi to anyone who is hungry and loves to have their food cooked directly in front of them!

ykQeBtx2iRDLcEAlejz6fQ.text: I could compare this to grocery store sushi but that would be a compliment. This was one of if not the worst sushi I have ever had. Chicken Hibachi was pretty bad too. The salmon sushi was disgusting I'm pretty sure I will get sick later. The shrimp tempura, well it was ice cold, soggy and I mean how can u not make that right? The half price day maybe had something to do with the bad quality but this sushi quality would get an F from me.

1tpJmXvj5mQcYbNLg8d1nQ.text: I truly wish there was a zero star rating in this case.  We attempted to dine at this restaurant and had the displeasure of meeting with the owner, who was unprofessional and inconsiderate. My husband has a food allergy  and so we asked to substitute the item he is allergic  to and was denied, after placing  the same order  successfully during  prior  visits at this establishment.  The owner didn't care and we  don't care to dine there again.  I guess someone  will have to have an allergic reaction  and sue him in order for him to care, since  he only seems to care about  money and not his customers.

wRngrX9IdrsRuMHCQOfwQQ.text: Ordered a spicy salmon roll, sake sashimi, and a side of fried rice for lunch.   The salmon roll was not spicy but it was good. The sashimi was ok. The fried rice was tasty.   I love the decor and seating inside, also the staff is super friendly and attentive!

chL1GnEl9FyAjclpbK1L5w.text: This locally owned family restaurant has been a favorite amongst University Area residents for years now.  Located just across from the University, in the back of the Harris Teeter, Kabuto's is probably the best Japanese style Hibachi and Sushi spot in the University City Bubble.  I LOVE their sushi.  Their fresh-water eel is unmatched.  I also love their California roll (sometimes I add salmon to it).  The sushi is always made fresh to order.  The rice is always soft and the wasabi is strong just the way I like it.  Although I am partial to the sushi bar located in the front of the restaurant, I have on the rare occasion, sat in the back, and partaken of the hibachi experience their fun and entertaining chiefs put on.  The experience is always entertaining and the food is always above-par.   There's nothing not to like about this place.  The service is ALWAYS exceptional.  I have been here well over 50 times in my time in Charlotte and have never had poor service here.  There is always plenty of parking located directly in front of the restaurant.    Kabuto's is one of those rare establishments in the University Area that are worth driving to if you don't live in the University City Bubble.  Though I don't live in the UCB anymore, Kabuto's is one of the few places that I still return to dine at on a regular basis.   EAT AT KABUTO'S!

-P8s_l0YVlBMexDBmFHFSw.text: I went here w friends 10/27 I was late so I had my food cooked in the back. My Friends had complained that the cook cooked their food super fast but I just laughed it off. My food finally came and my broccoli was clearly uncooked u could tell, when I touched it it was cold. I complained to the waiter he bought me more vegetables but I was so over it. I barely touched my food It was not good at all. I complained to the manager he only gave me 30% discount for poor service & undercooked food. Wouldn't recommend it

9-_m-6IQ-HcFcW1j_2RALA.text: I was craving some hibachi grilled food and this place jumped out at me.   The service was fine and our server made sure our drinks were always full.   The soup and salad came out in a timely manner and the overall flavor and taste of the food was decent, nothing to crave over though.  I was slightly disappointed in the noodles, that's all they were, just some heated up noodles on the grill, no flavor, not taste, no nothing, just noodles.    My reasoning for only two stars is that our cook was not very personable.   He did no tricks with his utensils, no volcano, no train, he didn't really interact with the group at all.  He cooked the food and that was about it.  When going to these hibachi grills, part of the reason for going is the entertainment and to have fun while the cook makes all your food.   I'll look to a different hibachi grill next time.

LzQGX5Xf6RBz4tWhVuIa3A.text: First time ordering here: chicken hibachi.  No good.  Chicken was extremely dry with pieces of dry scrapes from the grill, and noodles were also unforgivably dry.  No good.  I won't be ordering again. I cannot believe I paid so much for this.

2vUTZQOjF06mcpdLwTQJXw.text: My 3 children and I went to Kabuto to eat and we were at the Habachi table when I noticed mushrooms on the neighboring table. My family and I don't eat mushrooms.  My daughter asked to remove the mushrooms. We were that the chef said all vegetables. Or none. Then we decided to leave. I mentioned to manager that when you spending your money you should be able to order the food the way you want it.   He told me to cook at home if I want food the way I want.  We had words after that and the manager called me a nigger.  Major blowup.  Black folks need to start outing these kind of businesses and stop putting our dollars into these kind of establishments.  If I could give a negative star I would.   Very disappointed

N9MtaM_Fsr00lFfXGdRBCg.text: I came here with my husband and son for lunch. We were seated immediately as always and greeted promptly by our waiter. He was friendly and attentive and it's always a plus when they acknowledge the little ones. Even though they don't have to, greeting the children helps them to feel welcomed as well. Out of all of our visits here, this was the first time that our food was too salty. I was surprised because it's typically spot on in terms of seasoning. I will note that the chef was having a difficult time seeing whether or not any salt was coming out of the shaker...  The food is reasonably priced and much cheaper than the dinner menu. I will say that the restaurant could use some upgrades. The carpet is sticky and reminds me of the skating rink for some odd reason. I would recommend this restaurant for lunch, but can't say the higher dinner  prices are worth the money.

mj5F2QV5DYeb894GYCXSag.text: If I could give negative stars i would !! The manager at this establishment is absolutely horrible and lacks the basic level of respect and customer service !! My family and i came to this establishment excited with empty bellies ! When we received our rice and noodles it was a little to much pepper for my aunt and niece . We voiced our concern with hopes of just getting rice and noodles without the pepper and were denied ! The manger told my aunt " If You don't like the way i cook my food you need to eat at home "!! We were completely disgusted by his total disregard and lack of understanding ! He was arrogant and just plain mean... it was well recognized by his staff who constantly apologized and had a look of horror as we disclosed how our issue was handled ! I do no recommend this place what so ever ! Eat at your own discretion and pray nothings wrong with your food or you know you can just go home and cook your own !:(

0Xnz25bGJzd0WgkO8c0_sA.text: Was looking for a good place to get steak and sushi. Found this place on Yelp didn't bother reading the review just wanted to try it by the pictures people posted. Definitely a must try the owner was nice and so was the sushi chef. They both bs'd with me the whole time. I just moved to Charlotte from Arizona and been hunting good sushi places down. This is in my top 5 places to eat at now.

photos.caption: Photo of Kabuto Japanese Steak House & Sushi Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Kabuto Japanese Steak House & Sushi Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Kabuto Japanese Steak House & Sushi Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States

ptTR76oVVugObNeO4DT7BQ.text: I went there expecting to see a show as a romantic gesture and experience for me and my partner. All I got to see was a man cutting up veggies and frying rice and the meats. I really felt that for the price we should have gotten some kind of entertainment there was no interaction except him asking if we needed more sauce. Talk about quality I was very disappointed I could have watched a cooking show at home and been better off!

9ud6b77xfhZtCnk81PoxkA.text: I've been here before and I love the Hibachi Grill part of the restaurant but my friends and I decide to sit the sushi section and had many problems. They used paper menus where you write your orders, which is great in concept, but very poor in function. They forgot my friends salad till I mentioned it to them. They also forgot both of our soups we ordered. Then we get our appetizers 20 minutes after we have eaten most of our sushi. I normally understand these kind of situation when they are busy, but when there are only 4 other tables being used and ordering off this menu. That's when I slightly get upset. The food was good tho. I just felt the servers were more socialized and not really taking care of the guests.

z674XAJGrZjt1QXlHMKPMw.text: I will Never go to Kabutos in University Blvd again. I ordered a fried Carolina roll and it was soft and white on one side. I told them it was half way fried and could they fry it more.    The manager came over to me and told me he would make another but he would charge me.    I told me, I will make you another one but you will pay for it.  I told him why should I pay if I'm not eating this one. He just looked at me stern and said you will pay if I make you another one. He and I had a few words. He was rude and I told him He was unprofessional.  I said keep this one and I don't want anything else from here.    We asked for our check and left. The manager name wwas His name was Martin A. Tanaka

rNkfl7JrXgqxU1uZhqgIng.text: 1/2 price sushi on Wednesday's and Thursday's! Try the earthquake roll and add eel sauce (& siracha if you like a kick)! It'll change your life.   Great staff!

sEBper4qkcZ7KeCDSxtJXw.text: I wish I could give this place zero stars. My friend and I spoke with the owner about the sign on the door, which overtly targets a particular group of people in a discriminatory fashion. The hostess first tried to say this is in line with other places such as grocery stores, which do not allow people to wear hoodies. This is a LIE and is completely ridiculous (As are most excuses for prejudice and discrimination). The owner then tried to say customers don't want to see someone's underwear while eating. Since he tried to act like this was about modesty for the good of customers, we asked what his policy was on women wear extremely low cut shirts. He joked he would give them a discount. So the owner feels the need to express racist and sexist views. I will not be patronizing this restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Kabuto Japanese Steak House & Sushi Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. I cannot support a place that openly targets certain groups in a discriminatory way.

JLc_AfI8zvDvfutDXqPQbQ.text: Came for their special the 50% off sushi on Wednesday and as soon as I walked in I was greeted I'm not sure the guys name but he seem like he's the manager he was very nice very attentive the food was ready fast he continuously called me by my first name so it was a very personal experience and excellent great Customer Service I will continue to come back for the quality food and quality service this is a place that definitely gets five stars!!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Kabuto Japanese Steak House & Sushi Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Kabuto Japanese Steak House & Sushi Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Kabuto Japanese Steak House & Sushi Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States

w8eDsyGjyPFLhrZsHoONrg.text: After a 26+ year love affair with this restaurant it is time to say goodbye.  We went in on a Saturday night to celebrate a difficult chapter in our life coming to an end.  We walk in, gave our name, received a 40 minute wait time and told to sit anywhere we like for the wait  It was packed, a party was gathering in the waiting area and bar (30 plus people).  The rest of the family goes back to the car as I sit on the bench in the waiting area right beside the office door.  I can see the hostess stand.  The hostess ladies (3 of them) walk by me multiple times going in and out of the office.  After 50 minutes my husband walks back in to sit with me and stops by the hostess stand to see how much longer it might be.  Her response "we called your name four times and moved your name to the bottom of the list".  This simply did not happen.  They never once called our name.  Never once looked my way to see if any name they did call was me, etc.  As we had plans afterwards we could not wait another 40 minutes.  As I walked out I told the ladies that they never called my name and I was sitting there the entire time watching and listening. They immediately had an attitude, one girl puffing her chest out and rolling her head around being rude and extremely unprofessional.  Over 26 years folks.  I've stuck with them through the highs and lows, but this was the final straw.  I've never once complained about this establishment.  I've chatted with the owner many times and while I don't know him by name he would have recognized us immediately.  I asked for him and was told he was not there.  They are also screening his calls or keeping them from him.  Either way, her aggressive body language and horrible attitude was it for me. When you make a mistake, own it.   Thanks for the memories.

1faMM6woLDE1cM5qEfGmUg.text: This place was amazing!!!  Today was my daughter's birthday and she love this place so I took her here. We did not know that there was a minimum person count before they use the teppanyaki grill. Since there were only two of us, the waitress informed us they would not be able to accommodate. Of course that broke my daughter's heart as this was one of the reasons she loved this place (and the food of course). She started tearing up. I felt horrible because her weekend party was cancelled due to none of her friends were able to make it (summer birthdays are the worst) The staff at Kabuto decided to do the performance with the teppanyaki grill. This was the best gift they could have given my daughter. I will be a regular customer and definitely will recommend. Btw the food was delicious.

photos.caption: Photo of Kabuto Japanese Steak House & Sushi Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. She loves it!!
Photo of Kabuto Japanese Steak House & Sushi Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Best staff ever!! Thank you for putting a smile back on my daughter&#39;s face!!

AMvUopeeb1OHV__NwPYicQ.text: I don't get the negative reviews... We thought it was amazing both times we ate here, of course, we did get ours to go. Will have to be seated next visit...

eVJhdXYioe_wLiuObBGpBA.text: My wife and I went there for lunch yesterday.  It was pretty quiet.  The chef was young and seemed a little bit nervous to me.  The food was good.  The fried rice was excellent.  The fillets were good.  I think the fried rice and vegetables are better here than at the Pineville store.  I do believe that this store is a little more expensive than the Pineville store.  I am not sure why.  Overall an excellent steak and stir fry lunch!

BbSy2Jrm8IhoEzADSzHINw.text: Awful service!!! Weren't given drinks, soup, or salad until after the hibachi was ready. I don't know what's happened to this place but we won't be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Kabuto Japanese Steak House & Sushi Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Should have taken this as a sign not to eat here to tonight. Don&#39;t give them your money.

IadkEQA4Gu5s9-sVC7qv3w.text: Horrible customer service called to place a pick up order as I did the same way two days ago. The person who was taking the order tells me at the END of taking my order that there has to be a purchase of $10 or more to place a order using a card. Keep in mind I ordered the exact same thing Tuesday and was never informed of this policy and my order was taken by the manager. It is clear that there is some inconsistency and lack of communication. The issue isn't about paying its about the staff not being on one accord with policies.

F1MA5rXvLF377oX4cN8z5w.text: My sister and I come here quite often, on the half price days. If I could rate it a 2.5 I would've and here's why: 1. When you walk in the girl at the podium just stands there like a vegetable with a disgusted look on her face like she doesn't want to do her job.   2. The rest of the wait staff EXCEPT a girl and a guy (I can't recall their names) are horrible because they always have nasty attitudes. They need to be fired and the manager needs to hire people that are energetic, happy, and actually want to work there.   3. I have never gotten hibachi however when you're getting sushi and sit down sometimes they take forever to bring you menus and take your drink order.   TIP: ALWAYS HAVE PABLO MAKE YOUR SUSHI, NEVER THE OTHER GUY! He never cleans his station and when he made my sushi once it was absolutely disgusting. I don't know how he is still working there, Pablo always uses fresh ingredients and makes everything perfectly.  4. They NEVER give you enough shrimp sauce.  Other than those things, the sushi that Pablo makes is wonderful and is the only reason I come back to this restaurant.

LP5rTW8xZuOHUyUkAdAziA.text: People of color beware: I witnessed the manager call the cops on two young black men who wanted to frequent his establishment. When I confronted him about it he said that they smelled like weed. The two young men went to their cars to change but the racist and stubborn owner refused them service fully based on their color and the fact that he said "they smelled like weed." I was there went it happened as I ordered a to go meal but little did I know it was run by such poor management who judged people based off of their skin color and assumptions about how they smelled. It's 2019 and I know racism isn't dead but it hurt me to see two young men be turned away when they chose to frequent this establishment. When I confronted the manager I stated that what he did was wrong and that I won't be frequenting this establishment again , he said good bye. I think he should really reevaluate his judgment because it's hurting the people of this community. I just feel bad for the two young men that had to face someone's small mindedness knowing that they are not accepted by society due to the color of their skin and what they choose to do with their life. DONT WASTE YOUR MONEY HERE.

rzei6nY-XYpRYdedWXYknQ.text: Let me start off by saying that this restaurant was the worst place ive ever been to in my entire life ( no BS) First of all, We had a huge party so  we made reservations for 8:30pm. Unfortunately, we had to wait until all of our guest to get there, so we didn't get seated until 9:30pm. We had three full tables in the hibachi area and neither of us were served until almost 10pm.. the first table that was served got their soups, drinks , salads, and sushi a whole 15-20 mins before the other two tables did.  HOLD UP THOUGH! thats not even the WORST part!  when we finally got our chef, he rushed our dinner because they were "ready to close", which caused my chicken, a couple of others, and another girls shrimp to be undercooked! He also made very sexist and racist jokes towards black women about their hair, it was disgusting!   I tried to tell the waitress about the undercooked chicken, but she had an attitude the entire time she served us. (My drink was never filled unless I asked and my friend ordered sushi and an alcoholic beverage way before we got our chef and didn't receive any of it until after our chef was done "cooking" the hibachi.) so I asked her for her manager and he also came with the rudest demeanor. He gave me a 10% discount but I would've still had to pay $20 for the meal. I was not doing that!! so it took me to have to threaten to call his corporate and an inspector for me to get the entire meal half price...... I only paid $10 and it didn't even deserve that much! (the rice and veggies were dope tho)  overall, I would not recommend this place to anyone! Bad service and terrible cooks!!

r1mP6RXWRQ92CZTbcD4gOg.text: As someone new to Charlotte and a love of sushi...what better time to comb the city looking for sushi on INTERNATIONAL SUSHI DAY!!!   I asked around and someone recommended I come and here and they were spot on.   I walked into a warm welcome and an invitation to sit right in front of the chef since I was by myself. I was not disappointed, at the chef picked my dishes for me based on a few questions. His selections were sp good that I asked for another roll to go.   If you decide to go DM me on Yelp and I will gladly go with you as I love making friends and eating darn good sushi

photos.caption: Photo of Kabuto Japanese Steak House & Sushi Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States

7c-Sv_nxPhOdEHQ_47fu7Q.text: Sub par service and food. My daughter called in a take out order in a pinch. I arrived and they said it wasn't received. I verified the address and phone number. Apparently a young lady didn't enter the order. The owner proceeded to tell me I didn't order, it wasn't that place and began yelling. It was totally inappropriate. I will not be returning. Nakato nearby is better.

e9h6OmU-87ajcbrMiAb0mg.text: I'm only giving this restaurant one star because I can't leave any negative stars this was absolutely the worst experience of my lifeee our chef was sooo rude and unprofessional and there was egg shells in the rice the waiter was so oblivious too his racist slurs and when we complained to the owner twice!!!!! Nothing was done he was very nonchalant NEVER AGAIN!

gUDiyuWJWG1IS9F1dPyRbg.text: This use to be my favorite restaurant but not any more. It's dark, old and outdated inside. I was not able to get broccoli only and had to eat a vegetable mix that I didn't enjoy. The chairs are falling apart and the blinds are dusty. Red Ginger is my new favorite place to eat. I will no longer give money to this specific location.

1slf2okjzrKlOtb6Jkyctw.text: This location is not, I repeat, this location is not owned by the same people as the one in Pineville. The quality is not the same, in a bad way. And they do not allow you to order your veggies independently for some reason. I was told that if I want no mushrooms I would have to pick through the veggies myself to take them out. If the veggies are cooked fresh on the grill, why wouldn't I be able to only order zucchini and onion? I've seen so many pictures online where people only have zucchini and onion so what was the problem today???

6Mejr9kYVLEe9J7cz1vHhA.text: Wow! Can't believe they have this on their door. Boycott this place!   I've eaten here before but never again.

photos.caption: Photo of Kabuto Japanese Steak House & Sushi Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States

Ma4oIO-4ENQJi8qExf86LA.text: Such a delicious restaurant with all-star owners to match. Everyone is so friendly and polite, and the food is delicious.  Pro-tip: sushi specials on Wednesday and Thursday!! We go often enough that the waitresses know our orders: jalapeno roll, spicy tuna roll, California roll, and Arizona roll. But really, you can't go wrong with anything on the menu.  The hibachi is great too. I got chicken tonight to shake it up and I have so much food left over for tomorrow's lunch too. Yum!

photos.caption: Photo of Kabuto Japanese Steak House & Sushi Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. A delicious and beautifully plated Jalapeño roll. WeMre lucky I paused long enough to take a picture.

JcRgWGyqxx3BiQ_xhsCotA.text: What kind of racist subliminal message is this!!! This isn't subtle at all. You're clearly calling out a specific demographic with this message. No bueno.

photos.caption: Photo of Kabuto Japanese Steak House & Sushi Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States

Pg7y4d7Iqnf3rypJvrBZhw.text: We eat here at least once a week. The Sushi is awesome. I am an Arizona kid that has spent many summers in San Diego eating sushi. This is good stuff.

m76AxGdJxVlD9KF_fEgfrw.text: Pablo and the sushi crew are amazing. I eat here weekly in order to get my sushi fix. There is always ample parking and the hostess seats us quickly. They will provide you with a regular sushi menu however be sure to request the speciality menu too. I start off by having a salad with soy-ginger dressing, then some specialty rolls with soy sauce, eel sauce and shrimp sauce in the dipping dishes. Generally I have water so I don't convolute my sushi experience.   Throughout my weekly dining experience Pablo and the sushi crew are attentive, courteous and friendly. They even throw in some great laughs. Occasionally the owner who is generally hard at work includes a few interesting stories about the Japanese art in the sushi area.   I started coming for the sushi and now I stay for the people and the sushi.

photos.caption: Photo of Kabuto Japanese Steak House & Sushi Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Kabuto Japanese Steak House & Sushi Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Kabuto Japanese Steak House & Sushi Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States

nPSigMPzg9HfsK1yPJDynw.text: Soup is salt water. Salad drowned in dressing. Steak and shrimp very good! Way too much salt on everything and decor is old and dreary. Won't return to this one.

AINWc9BCzxfIj6d-Y4B8MA.text: Came here for my dad's birthday. Made a reservation, which was super easy. The food is good, and you get plenty of it!! It's the typical hibachi place; loud and hot (mostly from the fire and all the grills on). But I go to this place expecting a mountain of food and a good "show" - it never disappoints.

MHa3NFGCw2WrErYPn_N6ew.text: Was excited to spend time with family and get some hibachi. Imagine my surprise when we received over-peppered rice and pasta; couldn't enjoy the food because all you tasted was pepper...I tried to eat the food with the shrimp sauce and still overwhelming. Spoke with the manager that the chef was not the problem and we want to dine with them...could we get new rice and pasta without the seasoning and was told by him "that's what we serve and if you don't like it, you can eat at home"...I was taken aback and he said "it might sound brash, but those are the facts"...who provides this level of customer service...I was trying to eat at the establishment, as I have eaten here before, he continued "we have changed the process than what you were used to eating here before"...could not believe his attitude and although the food has been great...you may want to re-think your next meal here.   PS...keep in mind the food comes to the grill unseasoned so its not like they couldn't accommodate new rice and pasta from another grill before they seasoned it...ijs

VsZdDzNJxRTRptDM9KfILQ.text: I go here most Thursdays for sushi. Pablo is the best sushi chef. He bows what I like and don't like. He makes rolls that he knows I will enjoy. He makes sure my water is always refilled and I have the things I need. The servers also know my order and always provide me with a salad. The ginger dressing is scrumptious. I can't wait to go back.

photos.caption: Photo of Kabuto Japanese Steak House & Sushi Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States

OJOAuM4aji-SYE0C48CcTQ.text: Listen to these reviews, please. We don't eat mushrooms however, we are vegetarians. When asked to remove the mushrooms the manager said either you get all the vegetables or none. We literally picked them out of our food.. like seriously, why??? They have changed a lot! We used to be able to order the vegetables without the mushrooms.

WkpwoBqibBKG5_WeVfAMbA.text: Amazing sushi! Half off Weds & Thursday so we normally go then. Service is awesome and fast, everyone is super friendly. We get the Fox roll & the Jackpot every time and it's so yummy! You can tell the ingredients are fresh. Highly recommend. Plus they have hibachi tables which is always a great time too

photos.caption: Photo of Kabuto Japanese Steak House & Sushi Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States

WJdY5CnS8YpvECMzxqv9xA.text: I wish I could give this 0 stars. I had dietary restrictions that don't allow me to eat dairy or eggs. I asked the manager if I could have friend rice with no eggs and not only did he refuse to do it he was beyond rude. So rude I decided to leave because I did not want to give my money to an establishment that told me "sometimes it isn't about making the customer happy, it's about efficiency." I am not sure why it is 'Against' policy to place some rice aside from the rice cooked with egg but apparently it is. I could not believe the way I was treated. I left feeling so enraged, sad, and felt like I was not being accommodated.... pitiful.... worst experience and defiantly NOT somewhere I would recommend.... like ever ha!.

GowpLMvWuGVdJ0_OAEeQyA.text: Honestly, even on the 1/2 off days it's not worth it. The hibachi is worse than what you can get at other places for 6$. The sushi rice is the consistency of regular rice not real sushi rice. The food is bland, which is a lot coming from someone who likes food that's non offensive. The staff is rude and based of the experiences of others it is evident that the manager targets a specific demographic in the worst way.

LFr13lWHCbLu_5aD3NknJg.text: Best sushi place in the area. Highly recommended. They have wed and thurs specials for 50%! Isnt it perfect haha? Great service too.

AQO5FmF4pKh6QkEAv7-srQ.text: I haven't been here in a VERY LONG TIME, and after dinner for a friends birthday I see why. She came for her birthday during the 50off sushi and boy the quality was very poor. And presentation was awful as well, but the service was ok. It was horrible that we had to wait until the ENTIRE party arrived, and there was absolutely no one in the restaurant. Like it made no sense! I won't be going back unless it's a birthday party for someone and if it is I'll order water.   Not Pleased

photos.caption: Photo of Kabuto Japanese Steak House & Sushi Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Sunrise Crab Roll, Caterpillar, Eel Roll, Scallops, Tuna all for $25

-r7wlT-7ElebKv9hRUgycg.text: The food was good but the chef did not speak the whole time while cooking. I am not sure if it was his first day :\

hDSPky0XhsG0OQFf-_51hw.text: This is the fourth and final place we stopped at yesterday. The sushi bar is small and there isnt much of a variety of rolls to choose from. The sushi chef was great and he asked for our likes and dislikes. He altered our rolls to our liking and they were very good. He handed us, in two seperate occasions, complimentary rolls that he felt we would like. They were both very good. We would like to give this place a solid 3 - 3.5 stars but as we checked out we found that we were charged for one of the complimenary rolls by the owner. Maybe it was a misunderstanding. Maybe we should have said something. We may go again because we really enjoyed the sushi chef and the rolls. The chef said he would "hook us up" next time but we're worried of the spying owner that may charge us again for a complimentary roll, but it wont happen twice without a fight from us. We'll see....

W2y0OMHjIlSC6claLOGdQg.text: Kabuto has wonderful age tofu. I've been her numerous times with my boyfriend. We are still new to the area and last week when we ate at Kabuto's, we noticed that our car was running out of gas. The owner gave us directions and told us to call the restaurant if we ran out of gas before we got to the gas station and that he would help us. That is wonderful customer service.

TbyfWCQURAIMb1O7WWJNFg.text: Went to Kabuto in Charlotte's University area with my previous boss today.  The service was wonderful, the staff made sure I was happy and the food was wonderful!

lvMLf48k6wBDZ1ElsJO99A.text: Delicious Japanese food and crazy fast service. As your seated for dinner your soup is immediately given to you as the waitress takes your drink orders. The amount of food the chef prepares for you is enough for 2 meals! I love that I always bring home a leftover box. I'm not a vegetable fan, but the chicken and steak is always cooked how I like it. My drink is always kept filled and the managers are always walking around the restaurant making sure everyone is kept happy. Marten and his brother really make you feel welcomed and they definitely remember returning customers, which I love!! Thanks guys!

4eHV7FeKh1tqL5rkcf3v_g.text: I absolutely love japanese and i'm always looking for a place that isn't too expensive but tastes great...well i found it!  kabutos has become my weekly spot and one of my favorite places to dine.  the soup is tasty and the teriyaki chicken is top notch!!   portion sizes are enormous so you def. get what you pay for!!  they also put on a great show so for those who like a little entertainment with their meal.  the staff is very nice and friendly.  my food is always made to perfection, drinks always full and the staff treats me like family.  HIGHLY RECOMMEND!

zvqNDuC_5FduAKDyg-lG8w.text: I went here for lunch with some friends who are big fans for Sushi and it was delicious! I have been craving Sushi like crazy and this was more than satisfying. We had the Bagel Roll and NFL roll but the Earthquake roll was my favorite. I will definitely be back!

FfauVYaHEC5f6dQi7yEjZA.text: friently staff, good half price sushi on wed &thru. great place ..Sushi and beer ,,what else can you ask for!

-WoLMadY52b2CQfRba1agw.text: I have been going here for 7 years. Their sushi is excellent. Service is fast.   I order at the bar. They have a great selection of beer.  Ingredients are fresh and the sushi chef is incredibly skilled.  Sushi rolls are half off on Wednesday and Thursday.
